basics.name: Jonathan Tarrant
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I am a very determined, passionate and focused individual. I truly love what I do and I'm always on the hunt for fresh, exciting techniques and trends to apply to my projects and be at the forefront of today's best practices. I look to innovate and improve workflows by applying my technical skillset everywhere possible within a business. My personality is outgoing, my skillset is broad, I'm resourceful, motivated and looking for the next step up in my career as an engineer.

skills.name: Software & Platforms
keywords: AWS: cloudformation, s3, cloudfront, lambda, ECS, ElasticCache, API Gateway, SQS

work.summary: I joined Dunelm in order to help them create and launch their branch new fully serverless e-commerce platform. Dunelm being the biggest user of serverless in Europe I architect, develop and maintain world class serverless solutions within AWS Cloudformation Architecture. Within my first 2 months of being at Dunelm I had revolutionised their SEO content management and SEO workflow throughout the business.
highlights: Large monorepo React/Redux(Ducks pattern) Single Page Application front-end
Pioneering serverless architecture
React hooks
TypeScript both back and frontend
Cucumber automation testing
Meetings and demos with senior stakeholders in business
Business scenario driven development

work.summary: After two years at Holiday Extras I was given the opportunity to move into the theatre/theme breaks side of the business 'Shortbreaks' to help in fulfilment of new contracts in a team with a start up mindset. After an exceptional success, the team dissolved to then complete three large fulfillments gained in a short 6 month period. I now work in a new partner team as a fullstack developer in both back end and front end JavaScript environments.
highlights: Front-end/React-Redux and serverside/Node JavaScript development
Maintaining, monitoring and debugging micro-services and large APIs
Demoing to stakeholders, creating timelines and meeting deadlines
Working daily with AWS, Cloudfront, Lambda and IBM Cloud services
Working alongside Tech Leads, creating detailed plans to solve new business fulfillments. Additionally deciding feasibility and practicality of new projects
Large external clients such as Merlin Group and Warner

work.summary: At Holiday Extras Airport business I worked alongside the teams technical architect to create and maintain cloud micro services, a highly optimised front-end react static site project and LAMP legacy across 5 brands and multiple languages.
highlights: Working on Nodejs services with some exposure to AWS and lambda
Creating new react functionality, with page speed and unit tests
Working in a very agile environment
Creator and owner of companies Google AMP SEO Strategy, powering over 8000 instant mobile pages across multiple brands and languages.
Working in a sprint and pod business structure

work.summary: Bryter is a full service agency, working there exposed me to SEO, Marketing as well as full stack development on large LAMP based production websites.
highlights: Lead front end developer on large projects
Creating and maintaining PHP websites to deadlines
Server maintenance
Working with clients side by side, advising and deliverying their needs

work.summary: Working as a front end developer during University I began my web career at Gforces. Working with huge international brands and managing website development and email sends.
highlights: Sticking to strict brand guidelines for huge brands in the automotive industry
Creating and sending emails and newsletters for companies such as BMW, Vauxhall, Skoda
Managing 4-5 websites builds at the same time, keeping ticketing systems and the team up to date
